t: Proverbs 28
The*pn wicked flee when no one pursues, but*ld the righteous are bold as a lion.
When*ln a land transgresses, it has many rulers, but*ld with a man of understanding and knowledge, its*ld stability will long continue.
A*ln poor man who oppresses the poor is*ld a beating rain that leaves no food.
Those*ln who forsake the law praise the wicked, but*ld those who keep the law strive against them.
Evil*ln men do not understand justice, but*ld those who seek the Lord*s understand it completely.
Better*ln is a poor man who walks in his integrity than*ld a rich man who is crooked in his ways.
The*ln one who keeps the law is a son with understanding, but*ld a companion of gluttons shames his father.
Whoever*ln multiplies his wealth by interest and profit gathers*ld it for him who is generous to the poor.
If*ln one turns away his ear from hearing the law, even*ld his prayer is an abomination.
Whoever*ln misleads the upright into an evil way will*ld fall into his own pit, but*ld the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
A*ln rich man is wise in his own eyes, but*ld a poor man who has understanding will find him out.
When*ln the righteous triumph, there is great glory, but*ld when the wicked rise, people hide themselves.
Whoever*ln conceals his transgressions will not prosper, but*ld he who confesses and forsakes them will obtain mercy.
Blessed*ln is the one who fears the Lord*s always, but*ld whoever hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
Like*ln a roaring lion or a charging bear is*ld a wicked ruler over a poor people.
A*ln ruler who lacks understanding is a cruel oppressor, but*ld he who hates unjust gain will prolong his days.
If*ln one is burdened with the blood of another, he*ld will be a fugitive until death; let*ld no one help him.
Whoever*ln walks in integrity will be delivered, but*ld he who is crooked in his ways will suddenly fall.
Whoever*ln works his land will have plenty of bread, but*ld he who follows worthless pursuits will have plenty of poverty.
A*ln faithful man will abound with blessings, but*ld whoever hastens to be rich will not go unpunished.
To*ln show partiality is not good, but*ld for a piece of bread a man will do wrong.
A*ln stingy man hastens after wealth and*ld does not know that poverty will come upon him.
Whoever*ln rebukes a man will afterward find more favor than*ld he who flatters with his tongue.
Whoever*ln robs his father or his mother and*ld says, “That is no transgression,” is*ld a companion to a man who destroys.
A*ln greedy man stirs up strife, but*ld the one who trusts in the Lord*s will be enriched.
Whoever*ln trusts in his own mind is a fool, but*ld he who walks in wisdom will be delivered.
Whoever*ln gives to the poor will not want, but*ld he who hides his eyes will get many a curse.
When*ln the wicked rise, people hide themselves, but*ld when they perish, the righteous increase.
